alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:06PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, Elbert, Arapahoe and southwestern Lincoln Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 605 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Castle Rock to 4 miles northeast of Peyton to 3 miles northwest of Truckton, or along a line extending from 25 miles south of Denver to 23 miles northeast of Colorado Springs to 20 miles east of Colorado Springs. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. The Colorado Springs airport reported a wind gust to 58 mph with these storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aurora, eastern Centennial, Castle Rock, Parker, Elbert, Bennett, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Simla, Deer Trail, The Pinery, Matheson, Agate, Arapahoe Park, Franktown, Strasburg, Ponderosa Park, Byers, Castle Pines, and Kutch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
